originalText.text:
They are amazing people. Learnt a lot from them. Christians believe in God of Jewish people.
Thank you

originalText.text: Totally amazing movement... Helped me tremendously as a Jewish person who is now completed in Jesus...

text.text: Totally amazing movement... Helped me tremendously as a Jewish person who is now completed in Jesus...

originalText.text: What a beautiful ministry! I live in NYC where lots of Jewish people dwell. I’ve been so blessed by this ministry’s teachings and feel more equipped to minister to any Jewish person I might have the privilege of meeting here

text.text: What a beautiful ministry! I live in NYC where lots of Jewish people dwell. I’ve been so blessed by this ministry’s teachings and feel more equipped to minister to any Jewish person I might have the privilege of meeting here

originalText.text:
Belief in jesus and christian doctrine is 100% incompatible with Authentic Judaism.

Check out jewsforjudaism.org or outreachjudaism.org and decide for yourself.

After reading the organizations response, I will respond accordingly and let the reader do their own research:

Indeed the first Christian’s were Jews.
But that means nothing.
The first Communists were also Jews.
That also means nothing.
The fact that Jews were the first to do something does not mean that their actions were/are in compliance with Authentic Judaism.

Examine the claims of Jesus. He violated the Sabbath by the gospels own admission- thereby contradicting the Mosaic Covenant.

Jesus indeed said “I have not come to abolish the law, but to fulfill it.” But at the end of the day, abolish is indeed what he did.
For Example, if my boss tells me to place an order of 400 crates and I don’t do it, or I order just 200.
I can claim to him that “I didn’t disobey you, rather, I accomplished your dictate in a different way.”

If you would do that though, you’d be fired because that’s nonsense.

So for Jesus to say that he came to “fulfill, not abolish, the law”, is very nice.
But that is exactly what he did regardless of the label you may slap on it.

There are countless gaping holes in the ideas espoused, in the supposed proofs they bring from scripture, all of which are easily debunked upon examining the text without bias.

Examine the Mosaic Covenant without bias, without the Christian Lens, or even the Jewish Lens.

And then examine each of their interpretations.

The Christians altered the Hebrew word of “Alma,” in Isaiah 7:14, which means a young woman, and wrote the word virgin when nowhere in all 5 Books of Moses  does that word have such a definition.

Let all who seek truth approach the text without bias and then examine both sides of the debate.
And May we merit the true Jewish Messiah, who has yet to come, speedily in our days.

originalText.text: I am a Jewish believer in Jesus, and at the time Jesus found me, I was 20 years old.  I thought that I must be the first Jewish believer ever.  Then I found Jews for Jesus.....and felt at home.  For awhile I even worked with Jews for Jesus in the Ft. Lauderdale, FL branch.  You all were so important in my early days as a Christian:  I was not alone!  Thank you!
